movie_title: 12 Minutes of Japan Facts You (Probably) Didn't Know
introduction: I asked my Japanese friends for interesting lore about Japan and they gave me some pretty interestin
lead_intro: Discover fascinating and quirky facts about Japan with insights into its culture and traditions.

quiz.question: What is the name of the clapping pattern that Japanese people use to end their meetings?
quiz.explanation: In the text, it is mentioned that Sanbonjime is the most formal clapping pattern used for big celebrations.

quiz.question: Which city in Japan has a unique way of riding escalators compared to the rest of the country?
quiz.explanation: The text states that in Osaka, people stand on the right side of escalators, which is different from the standard practice in Japan.

quiz.question: What is the belief behind the baby sumo wrestling tradition in Japan?
quiz.explanation: The text explains that the tradition of baby sumo wrestling is based on the belief that 'crying babies grow up healthy.'

quiz.question: Who was the individual who mapped Japan on foot in the 1700s?
quiz.explanation: Ino Tadataka is mentioned in the text as the person who walked around Japan for 17 years to create detailed maps of the country.

quiz.question: What disease ravaged Japan during the Edo period due to a diet high in white rice?
quiz.explanation: The text explains that the deficiency caused by a diet lacking thiamine in white rice led to what was known as the Edo disease, now recognized as beriberi.
